summary: This is an internal FBI New York Field Office newsletter dated June 5, 2025, summarizing significant news events. It covers multiple FBI investigations, including domestic terrorism cases, and notably contains a section where Deputy Director Bongino confirms Jeffrey Epstein's death was a suicide based on agency files.

persons.name: Daniel Jongyon Park
persons.context: Charged by the FBI with providing material support to a terrorist for his role in the bombing of a Palm Springs fertility clinic.

persons.name: Guy Edward Bartkus
persons.context: Detonated a car bomb at a Palm Springs fertility clinic, killing himself and injuring others.

persons.name: Au Davis
persons.role: Assistant Director, FBI Los Angeles Field Office
persons.context: Quoted discussing the ideology of Park and Bartkus in the Palm Springs clinic bombing case.

persons.name: Bondi
persons.context: Personally helped facilitate an expulsion and commented on Park's arrest, calling the clinic bombing a 'cruel, disgusting crime'.

persons.name: Patel
persons.context: Quoted on the Park arrest and commented on the Boulder, Colorado terror attack investigation.

persons.name: Mohamed Sabry Soliman
persons.context: Suspect in the Boulder firebombing attack, charged with a federal hate crime and attempted murder.

persons.name: Hayam El Gamal
persons.context: Wife of Mohamed Sabry Soliman, whose deportation was halted by a U.S. federal judge.

persons.name: Steve Redfearn
persons.context: Contacted the FBI's Denver field office after the Boulder attack, initially surprised by Director Patel's public post about it being terrorism.

persons.name: Bongino
persons.context: Confirmed Jeffrey Epstein's death was a suicide based on agency files and discussed other FBI investigations.

persons.name: August Pfluger
persons.context: Leading a House Homeland Security Committee hearing on rising antisemitic violence.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Previously warned about foreign terrorists exploiting U.S. borders, quoted from April 2024 testimony.

persons.name: Lirim Sylejmani
persons.context: U.S. citizen sentenced to 10 years in prison for joining and fighting for ISIS.

persons.name: Brian Thompson
persons.context: Gunned down outside a Manhattan hotel in December.

persons.name: Luigi Mangione
persons.context: Suspect in the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson; his diary expressed desire to kill an insurance executive.

persons.name: Tim O'Hara
persons.context: Disclosed that a complaint about alleged financial misconduct at the NAACP Providence branch was referred to the FBI.

persons.name: Kristen Setera
persons.context: Told an outlet the FBI does not confirm or deny investigations, regarding the NAACP Providence branch complaint.

persons.name: Dominik Whitehead
persons.context: Issued a statement about suspending the Providence NAACP branch's leadership for non-compliance.

persons.name: Tony Clark
persons.context: Named as a union executive in a federal investigation into whether money from OneTeam Partners was improperly used.

persons.name: Charlotte Walls
persons.context: One of the producers whose identity was impersonated by a scammer reported to the FBI.

persons.name: Richard Leon
persons.context: Weighing a request to unseal records of the FBI's surveillance of Martin Luther King Jr.

persons.name: Stephen Miller
persons.role: White House Deputy Chief of Staff
persons.context: Reportedly 'berated' staff and threatened firings in a meeting about ICE deportation arrest numbers.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of confirmation by Deputy Director Bongino that his death was a suicide based on FBI files.

persons.name: Martin Luther King Jr.
persons.context: Subject of FBI surveillance records that a judge is weighing whether to unseal.

connections.description: Met online and shared an extremist ideology; Park allegedly supplied explosives to Bartkus for the clinic bombing.
Soliman is the suspect in the Boulder attack; El Gamal is his wife, whose deportation was halted.
Mangione is the suspect in the killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson.
Interagency relationship; Director Patel's public post about the Boulder attack being terrorism initially surprised Police Chief Redfearn.
Deputy Director Bongino confirmed the FBI's conclusion that Epstein's death was a suicide.

events.title: Palm Springs Fertility Clinic Bombing
events.description: Guy Edward Bartkus detonated a car bomb at a fertility clinic in Palm Springs, killing himself and injuring several others.

events.title: Arrest in Palm Springs Bombing
events.description: Daniel Jongyon Park was charged by the FBI with providing material support to a terrorist for his role in the Palm Springs clinic bombing.

events.title: Deportation of Boulder Suspect's Family Halted
events.description: A U.S. federal judge halted the deportation of the Egyptian family of Boulder firebombing suspect Mohamed Sabry Soliman.

events.title: FBI Confirms Epstein Suicide
events.description: FBI Deputy Director Bongino publicly confirmed, based on agency files including video, that Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide.

events.title: House Hearing on Antisemitic Violence
events.description: The House Homeland Security Committee, led by Rep. August Pfluger, is scheduled to hold a hearing on rising antisemitic violence and terror attacks in the U.S.

events.title: Sentencing for ISIS Fighter
events.description: Lirim Sylejmani, a U.S. citizen, was sentenced to 10 years in prison for joining and fighting for ISIS.

events.title: Killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO
events.description: UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was gunned down outside a Manhattan hotel.

events.title: NAACP Providence Branch Referred to FBI
events.description: Providence Police referred a complaint about alleged financial misconduct at the local NAACP branch to the FBI.

keyFacts: FBI Deputy Director Bongino confirmed Jeffrey Epstein's death was a suicide based on the agency's files, including video evidence.
The document is an internal FBI newsletter dated June 5, 2025, indicating it is a future-dated or fictional document within the Epstein case files.
The newsletter summarizes multiple, disparate FBI investigations and news events, blending real-world contexts with future dates.
It reports on a major domestic terrorism case involving the bombing of a Palm Springs fertility clinic.
It details interagency dynamics between the FBI and local police in the investigation of the Boulder, Colorado terror attack.
